006
007package renderer.scene.primitives;
008
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011
012/**
013   A {@code Triangle} object has two lists of three integers each.
014   One list represents the three corners of the triangle in space.
015   The integers are indices into the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
016   list of a {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. The other list
017   holds integer indices into the {@link java.awt.Color} list of
018   that {@link renderer.scene.Model} object.
019<p>
020   Since a {@code Triangle} is made of three points, and three points
021   determine a plane, a {@code Triangle} is always "flat".
022<p>
023   A {@code Triangle} is also always "convex".
024<p>
025   The combination of flat and convex means that we can give a
026   {@code Triangle} an orientation and we can determine if the
027   {@code Triangle} if "front facing" or "back facing".
028*/
029public class Triangle extends OrientablePrimitive
030{
031   // A Triangle object can have an index into its Model's list of Textures
032   // and a list of indices to texture coordinates in the Model.
033   public final boolean textured;
034   public final int textureIndex;
035   public final List<Integer> tcIndexList;
036
037   /**
038      Construct a {@code Triangle} object using three integer indices.
039      Use the given indices for both the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
040      list and the front and back {@link java.awt.Color} lists.
041
042      @param i0  index for 1st {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
043      @param i1  index for 2nd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
044      @param i2  index for 3rd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
045   */
046   public Triangle(final int i0, final int i1, final int i2)
047   {
048      this(i0, i1, i2,
049           i0, i1, i2);
050   }
051
052
053   /**
054      Construct a {@code Triangle} object using three integer indices
055      for the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list and one integer index
056      for the {@link java.awt.Color} list. Make the back face color the
057      same as the front face color.
058
059      @param i0  index of 1st {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
060      @param i1  index of 2nd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
061      @param i2  index of 3rd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
062      @param c   index of the {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
063   */
064   public Triangle(final int i0, final int i1, final int i2, final int c)
065   {
066      this(i0, i1, i2,
067           c,  c,  c);
068   }
069
070
071   /**
072      Construct a {@code Triangle} object using three integer indices
073      for the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list and three integer indices
074      for the {@link java.awt.Color} list. Make the back face colors the
075      same as the front face colors.
076      <p>
077      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
078      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@code Triangle}'s
079      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
080      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
081      {@code Triangle} gets rendered).
082
083      @param i0  index of 1st {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
084      @param i1  index of 2nd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
085      @param i2  index of 3rd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
086      @param c0  index of 1st {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
087      @param c1  index of 2nd {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
088      @param c2  index of 3rd {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
089   */
090   public Triangle(final int i0, final int i1, final int i2,
091                   final int c0, final int c1, final int c2)
092   {
093      this(i0, i1, i2,
094           c0, c1, c2,
095           c0, c1, c2);
096   }
097
098
099   /**
100      Construct a {@code Triangle} object using three integer indices
101      for the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list, three integer indices
102      for the front face {@link java.awt.Color} list, and three indices for
103      the back face {@link java.awt.Color} list.
104      <p>
105      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
106      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@code Triangle}'s
107      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
108      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
109      {@code Triangle} gets rendered).
110
111      @param i0  index of 1st {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
112      @param i1  index of 2nd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
113      @param i2  index of 3rd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
114      @param c0  index of 1st {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
115      @param c1  index of 2nd {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
116      @param c2  index of 3rd {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
117      @param c3  index of 1st backface {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
118      @param c4  index of 2nd backface {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
119      @param c5  index of 3rd backface {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
120   */
121   public Triangle(final int i0, final int i1, final int i2,
122                   final int c0, final int c1, final int c2,
123                   final int c3, final int c4, final int c5)
124   {
125      super();
126
127      vIndexList.add(i0);
128      vIndexList.add(i1);
129      vIndexList.add(i2);
130      cIndexList.add(c0);
131      cIndexList.add(c1);
132      cIndexList.add(c2);
133      cIndexList2.add(c3);
134      cIndexList2.add(c4);
135      cIndexList2.add(c5);
136      this.textured = false;
137      this.textureIndex = -1;
138      this.tcIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
139   }
140
141
142   /**
143      Construct a {@code Triangle} object using three integer indices
144      for the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list and three indices
145      for the {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} list.
146      <p>
147      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
148      or {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} objects into this {@code Triangle}'s
149      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that the
150      given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this {@code Triangle}
151      gets rendered).
152
153      @param i0   index of 1st {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
154      @param i1   index of 2nd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
155      @param i2   index of 3rd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
156      @param tc0  index of 1st {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} of the new {@code Triangle}
157      @param tc1  index of 2nd {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} of the new {@code Triangle}
158      @param tc2  index of 3rd {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} of the new {@code Triangle}
159      @param textureIndex  integer index into a {@link renderer.scene.Texture} list
160   */
161   public Triangle(final int i0,  final int i1,  final int i2,
162                   final int tc0, final int tc1, final int tc2,
163                   final int textureIndex)
164   {
165      super();
166
167      vIndexList.add(i0);
168      vIndexList.add(i1);
169      vIndexList.add(i2);
170      cIndexList.add(0);  // assume the model has at least one color
171      cIndexList.add(0);
172      cIndexList.add(0);
173      cIndexList2.add(0);
174      cIndexList2.add(0);
175      cIndexList2.add(0);
176      this.tcIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
177      tcIndexList.add(tc0);
178      tcIndexList.add(tc1);
179      tcIndexList.add(tc2);
180      this.textured = true;
181      this.textureIndex = textureIndex;
182   }
183
184
185   /**
186      Construct a {@code Triangle} object using three integer indices
187      for the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list, three integer indices
188      for the front face {@link java.awt.Color} list, and three indices
189      for the {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} list.
190      <p>
191      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
192      or {@link java.awt.Color} or {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} objects
193      into this {@code Triangle}'s {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This
194      constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid
195      by the time this {@code Triangle} gets rendered).
196
197      @param i0   index of 1st {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
198      @param i1   index of 2nd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
199      @param i2   index of 3rd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
200      @param c0   index of 1st {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
201      @param c1   index of 2nd {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
202      @param c2   index of 3rd {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
203      @param tc0  index of 1st {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} of the new {@code Triangle}
204      @param tc1  index of 2nd {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} of the new {@code Triangle}
205      @param tc2  index of 3rd {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} of the new {@code Triangle}
206      @param textureIndex  integer index into a {@link renderer.scene.Texture} list
207   */
208   public Triangle(final int i0,  final int i1,  final int i2,
209                   final int c0,  final int c1,  final int c2,
210                   final int tc0, final int tc1, final int tc2,
211                   final int textureIndex)
212   {
213      super();
214
215      vIndexList.add(i0);
216      vIndexList.add(i1);
217      vIndexList.add(i2);
218      cIndexList.add(c0);
219      cIndexList.add(c1);
220      cIndexList.add(c2);
221      cIndexList2.add(c0);
222      cIndexList2.add(c1);
223      cIndexList2.add(c2);
224      this.tcIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
225      tcIndexList.add(tc0);
226      tcIndexList.add(tc1);
227      tcIndexList.add(tc2);
228      this.textured = true;
229      this.textureIndex = textureIndex;
230   }
231
232
233   /**
234      Construct a {@code Triangle} object using three integer indices
235      for the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list, three integer indices
236      for the front face {@link java.awt.Color} list, three integer indices
237      for the back face {@link java.awt.Color} list, and three indices
238      for the {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} list.
239      <p>
240      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
241      or {@link java.awt.Color} or {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} objects
242      into this {@code Triangle}'s {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This
243      constructor assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be valid
244      by the time this {@code Triangle} gets rendered).
245
246      @param i0   index of 1st {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
247      @param i1   index of 2nd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
248      @param i2   index of 3rd {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} of the new {@code Triangle}
249      @param c0   index of 1st {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
250      @param c1   index of 2nd {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
251      @param c2   index of 3rd {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
252      @param c3   index of 1st backface {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
253      @param c4   index of 2nd backface {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
254      @param c5   index of 3rd backface {@link java.awt.Color} of the new {@code Triangle}
255      @param tc0  index of 1st {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} of the new {@code Triangle}
256      @param tc1  index of 2nd {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} of the new {@code Triangle}
257      @param tc2  index of 3rd {@link renderer.scene.TexCoord} of the new {@code Triangle}
258      @param textureIndex  integer index into a {@link renderer.scene.Texture} list
259   */
260   public Triangle(final int i0,  final int i1,  final int i2,
261                   final int c0,  final int c1,  final int c2,
262                   final int c3,  final int c4,  final int c5,
263                   final int tc0, final int tc1, final int tc2,
264                   final int textureIndex)
265   {
266      super();
267
268      vIndexList.add(i0);
269      vIndexList.add(i1);
270      vIndexList.add(i2);
271      cIndexList.add(c0);
272      cIndexList.add(c1);
273      cIndexList.add(c2);
274      cIndexList2.add(c3);
275      cIndexList2.add(c4);
276      cIndexList2.add(c5);
277      this.tcIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
278      tcIndexList.add(tc0);
279      tcIndexList.add(tc1);
280      tcIndexList.add(tc2);
281      this.textured = true;
282      this.textureIndex = textureIndex;
283   }
284
285
286   /**
287      Construct a {@code Triangle} object using the two given
288      {@link List}s of integer indices. Make the back face colors
289      the same as the front face colors.
290      <p>
291      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
292      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
293      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
294      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
295      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
296
297      @param vIndexList  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list
298      @param cIndexList  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.Color} list
299      @throws NullPointerException if {@code vIndexList} is {@code null}
300      @throws NullPointerException if {@code cIndexList} is {@code null}
301      @throws IllegalArgumentException if the size of {@code vIndexList} or {@code cIndexList} is not 3
302   */
303   public Triangle(final List<Integer> vIndexList,
304                   final List<Integer> cIndexList)
305   {
306      super(vIndexList, cIndexList);
307      this.textured = false;
308      this.textureIndex = -1;
309      this.tcIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
310   }
311
312
313   /**
314      Construct a {@code Triangle} object using the three given
315      {@link List}s of integer indices.
316      <p>
317      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
318      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
319      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
320      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
321      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
322
323      @param vIndexList   {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list
324      @param cIndexList   {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.Color} list
325      @param cIndexList2  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.Color} list
326      @throws NullPointerException if {@code vIndexList} is {@code null}
327      @throws NullPointerException if {@code cIndexList} is {@code null}
328      @throws NullPointerException if {@code cIndexList2} is {@code null}
329      @throws IllegalArgumentException if the size of any one of the index lists is not 3
330   */
331   public Triangle(final List<Integer> vIndexList,
332                   final List<Integer> cIndexList,
333                   final List<Integer> cIndexList2)
334   {
335      super(vIndexList, cIndexList, cIndexList2);
336      this.textured = false;
337      this.textureIndex = -1;
338      this.tcIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
339   }
340
341
342   /**
343      Construct a {@code Triangle} object using the four given
344      {@link List}s of integer indices.
345      <p>
346      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
347      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
348      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
349      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
350      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
351
352      @param vIndexList   {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list
353      @param cIndexList   {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.Color} list
354      @param cIndexList2  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.Color} list
355      @param tcIndexList  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.TexCoord} list
356      @param textureIndex  integer index into a {@link renderer.scene.Texture} list
357      @throws NullPointerException if {@code vIndexList} is {@code null}
358      @throws NullPointerException if {@code cIndexList} is {@code null}
359      @throws NullPointerException if {@code cIndexList2} is {@code null}
360      @throws NullPointerException if {@code tcIndexList2} is {@code null}
361      @throws IllegalArgumentException if the size of any one of the index lists is not 3
362   */
363   public Triangle(final List<Integer> vIndexList,
364                   final List<Integer> cIndexList,
365                   final List<Integer> cIndexList2,
366                   final List<Integer> tcIndexList,
367                   final int textureIndex)
368   {
369      super(vIndexList, cIndexList, cIndexList2);
370
371      if (null == tcIndexList)
372         throw new NullPointerException("tcIndexList must not be null");
373      if (vIndexList.size() != tcIndexList.size() )
374         throw new IllegalArgumentException("vIndexList and tcIndexList must be the same size");
375
376      this.tcIndexList = tcIndexList;
377      this.textured = true;
378      this.textureIndex = textureIndex;
379   }
380
381
382   /**
383      For debugging.
384
385      @return {@link String} representation of this {@code Triangle} object
386   */
387   @Override
388   public String toString()
389   {
390      String result = "Triangle: (["
391                           + vIndexList.get(0)  + ", "
392                           + vIndexList.get(1)  + ", "
393                           + vIndexList.get(2)  + "], ["
394                           + cIndexList.get(0)  + ", "
395                           + cIndexList.get(1)  + ", "
396                           + cIndexList.get(2)  + "], ["
397                           + cIndexList2.get(0) + ", "
398                           + cIndexList2.get(1) + ", "
399                           + cIndexList2.get(2) + "]";
400      if (this.textured)
401      {
402         result += " with texture index " + textureIndex;
403         result += ", tc: [" + tcIndexList.get(0) + ", "
404                             + tcIndexList.get(1) + ", "
405                             + tcIndexList.get(2) + "]";
406      }
407      result += ")";
408      return result;
409   }
410}
